poem:
Title: The Unyielding Gavel

The starched calm of the courtroom,
undaunted by presidential echo.
Spring snow in the forecast,
masked by the scent of scandal.
The judge, a fixed star amidst
the swirling circus - begins counting.
His gavel falls, a sudden end -
to the nudged delay.
April asserts herself in this narrative.
Justice threads its way, within her blossoming.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
